content.user_title: Automate npm releases with version sync
content.value_statement: Manual npm releases often lead to version mismatches between package.json, git tags, and changelogs. This skill provides a step-by-step workflow that keeps all version markers in perfect sync for safe, consistent publishing.
actual_capabilities: Guides through semantic versioning (patch, minor, major)
Ensures version sync across package.json, CHANGELOG.md, and git tags
Provides step-by-step git operations for release commits
Includes dry-run testing before actual npm publish
Documents rollback procedures for failed releases
limitations: Requires main branch with clean working directory
Does not support pre-release or beta versions

best_practices: Always run npm publish --dry-run first to catch packaging issues before publishing
Update CHANGELOG.md before committing version changes to maintain documentation accuracy
Use annotated git tags with descriptive release messages for better traceability
Verify package installation works after publishing to confirm successful release
anti_patterns: Never push git tags before committing version changes - causes version mismatch
Do not skip changelog updates for any release - breaks traceability
Avoid manual version editing without using npm version command - causes errors

faq.question: Is this compatible with other npm packages?
faq.answer: The workflow is generic but examples reference cc-devflow. Adapt the package name and repository URLs for your project.

faq.question: What if npm publish fails due to network issues?
faq.answer: The workflow includes network troubleshooting steps. Retry after connection stabilizes or switch to SSH for git operations.

faq.question: Can I use this for beta or pre-release versions?
faq.answer: The current workflow focuses on stable releases. Pre-release versions need additional npm tag configuration.

faq.question: How do I handle release failures after 72 hours?
faq.answer: After 72 hours, npm unpublish is unavailable. Publish a new patch version with the fix instead of unpublishing.

faq.question: Does this integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: This is a manual workflow. For CI/CD integration, you will need additional automation scripts and npm tokens.

faq.question: What permissions do I need?
faq.answer: npm publish permission for the package, git push access to the repository, and optionally GitHub CLI for release creation.
